title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
The big tech companies that drove U.S. office demand for years are now canceling leases and flooding business districts with office space as they downsize.

Activist TCI called on Alphabet to aggressively cut costs and reduce losses in long-term bets, saying the company would be more efficient with fewer employees.

FTX's founder thinks that he can raise enough money to make users of the collapsed cryptocurrency exchange whole, people familiar with the matter say.

Producer-price increases in the U.S. slowed in October for the second straight month, adding to signs that inflation pressures could be abating.

U.S. stocks rose, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow industrials notching gains of 0.9%, 1.4% and 0.2%, respectively.

Microsoft announced enhanced policies it said are aimed at preventing sexual harassment and gender discrimination, in response to an independent review.

Berkshire made an investment valued at roughly $4.1 billion in TSMC.

What's News: Business & Finance
